info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 9:22PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW... At 922 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was located along a line extending from near Springfield to Pocatello Airport to Pocatello to 9 miles east of Fort Hall Bannock Peak. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. Locations impacted include... Southern Idaho Falls, eastern Pocatello, Blackfoot, Driggs, Swan Valley, Ririe Reservoir, Palisades Reservoir, Chesterfield Reservoir, Goshen, Blackfoot Reservoir, Chubbuck, Ammon, Shelley, Victor, Inkom, Firth, Tetonia, Irwin, Rose and Fort Hall Putnam Lodge. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one inch per hour or more in this band of heavy snow. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this band of heavy snow. Visibilities are below one quarter of a mile in this band of heavy snow. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations. Wind gust to 40 mph have been reported with this band of snow. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect for the area. Please monitor local media outlets and the National Weather Service for further statements. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
